Rachel) is a mom, writer, rock climber, and deep-thinking, fun-loving pal of many. 

Jim Rohn, the beloved motivational speaker, used to say that his profession was "talking about things that matter with people who care." Frankly, I can't think of much I aspire to more. If you are some who cares about things that matter, this is your new home away from home. 

At the core of each meetup is the desire to create meaningful experiences where we explore wellness on a physical, emotional, and spiritual level, as individuals and members of the wider world. results.description:
As a brand new unconventional Relationship Coach hitting the NYC scene, I have decided to create a place for sharing and healing.  I will push your mind to the limits and possibly shock and awe you with my personal experiences, but its all in good fun and designed to transform your life.  With my lighthearted & humorous approach you're sure to have a great time!


Do you want to transcend fear in your relationship? Would you love to beat jealousy? Do you wish you understood your partner better or just want a stronger bond? Are you single and afraid to love because you have been hurt too many times or you can't find someone that meets your standards? 

<br>

If so, this is the group for you! This meetup is a movement that will consist of community forums, a talk show (which will be aired online) & an original reality show project that has NEVER been done before!   We will be meeting weekly to watch a variety of TV shows, documentaries & video testimonials covering many relationship topics ranging from infidelity, polyamory, monogamy, marriage, divorce, cohabitation, successful dating, living apart together (LAT) & much more.  After the screening, we will discuss what we have just watched while I share my unconventional relationship experiences with the group. My lighthearted & humorous approach will fun & delightful experience!

<br>

You may also sign up for a variety of break out programs that will be a part of the overall movement.  To cover our rental location, refreshments & guest bookings, group forums will cost between $10 - $30. Our special after work discounted screening & discussion sessions will cost only $7!
results.name: Hard Truth Real Love!

This group is for anyone who is interested in discussing or learning about WordPress as a user, developer or designer. WordPress is the Internet's most popular and fastest growing content management system for business and blogging websites .

This group is a monthly gathering to discuss how to best leverage your website to get your message out into the interweb. Each month there will be a topic discussion as well as time to get your questions answered on websites, marketing, SEO, Web Design, Social Media and related topics and technologies.

Our goal is to foster a supportive environment where that meets the needs of the members.  


Whether you are a user, designer, developer, webmaster or just have questions about WordPress usage, designing WordPress Themes and styles or creating WordPress Plugins and Widgets this will be a great resource for you.

The internet is changing rapidly which makes it difficult to know "what's working now". The presentations will be focusing on real scenarios and battle tested solutions.

This Meetup is:

• A great place to meet other people like you who are interested in using WordPress achieve their organizational or personal goals.

• For the benefit of the WordPress community and others interested in learning more about WordPress with a focus on the best interest of the members.

• Volunteer-run with volunteer speakers and we encourage your participation.

• A welcoming place where we are committed to fostering an accepting environment.

• A great place to share your knowledge and experience with other members

• For businesses, entrepreneurs, writers, bloggers, marketers, students and others looking to communicate through a website.


Come join us to learn and share!

results.description: Are you discouraged from the ups and downs of the stock market? Interested in making money through real estate investing? Are you serious about getting a solid real estate education? Then consider the Metro Real Estate Investors Association. We are a merger of associations and can trace our roots all the way back to 1982! If you think that you can get rich quick, with not doing any work...you have been mislead. Please do not get ripped off by spending anywhere from $2,000 to as much as $25,000 for so-called real estate education or mentoring. Metro REIA is comprised of beginning and experienced investors. We present local speakers who offer education specific to New Jersey and who have a high level of expertise in various real estate related topics. Twice a year we sponsor National Speakers. And contrary to other organizations, we charge our members only $29 for an all-day workshop. Our members are VOLUNTEERS who enjoy giving back to other members their successes AND mistakes! Our mission is to provide solid real estate education to achieve financial independence. Each meeting also provides an opportunity for members to announce potential deals to others and there is also sufficient time for networking. For further information please visit www.mreia.com. You can click on Past Meetings/Events to see the topics and speakers we presented going all the back to 1985! You can also click on UPCOMING MEETINGS to see the year's meeting schedule of topics. We also publish an e-newsletter every month which usually contains from 25 to 28 articles. It is the most comprehensive newsletter in the United States. And it gets even better: members can view any of the over 2500 articles going back to November 2002. Here are some of the topics we have explored in the past: Landlording, Lease/Options/Buying "Subject to," Asset Protection, Entities, Creative Financing, Private Financing, Seller Financing, Dealmaking, Environmental Problems, Finding Deals, Selling Strategies, Wholesaling, Foreclosures, Insurance, Home Inspections, Renovation Tips, Legal Concerns, Marketing, Negotiating Strategies, Options, REO Properties, Short Sales, Self-Directed IRAs, Technology and Tax Reduction. We meet on the third Monday of every month at the Hotel Woodbridge at Metropark, 120 Wood Ave South, just off Exit 131 of the Garden State Parkway. Visitors: $15. Annual membership: $150 or $275 for a two year membership. Call Dan (President) at 201-791-44639 if you still have questions after visiting www.mreia.com
results.name: Metro Real Estate Investors Association

results.description:
Welcome Storytellers!

Would it be far-fetched to say that you're tired of looking for writing partners or people to read your scripts/stories? Well, look no more!

The Story Beats Lab is an intense writers lab for aspiring and semi-professional TV/Film writers (and authors) interested in workshopping stories still in pre-development, while also getting professional feedback.

• We meet weekly to workshop new scripts and stories.

• We orchestrate pitchfests (designed to improve how writers pitch their loglines), offer plot development feedback and short stage readings (via an opening page test). Writers are encouraged to bring material related to feature scripts, pilot/spec episodes, shorts, web series scripts, and novel outlines.

Our labs are specifically tailored for TV/Film scriptwriters and authors during pre-development stages.

Our mission is to help scriptwriters and authors during pre-development, while also increasing efficiency and quality output.  If you desire real feedback, from real writers, as deep in the zone as you - we dare you to join our group.

results.description:
Who should Join:   Smart, savvy, ambitious women to improve their communication skills and voice in todays in the workplace in order to bring their careers to the next level.   We think getting ambitious women in a room together talking, and learning new skills we can build a community to  create positive change in the paradigm of what "works" in communication.    This is an 18+ event. 

  Vital Voice Jam Sessions are quick and dirty hour long sessions to work on specific skill sets dealing with communication, networking, and getting your voice heard. Our workshops aim to be as fun as they are informative.   

Jam Sessions have come out of a desire to start to tackle some of the more specific concerns our clients come to us with:  How to give an elevator pitch, Networking for Introverts, Negotiation, Interview Skills, Dealing with interruptions, Pitching Important Ideas.  While these are big issues that will certainly not be fully resolved in an hour, we can get you started in thinking about them in a different way- and give you a few tools to add to your tool bag.    

1st Session will be Art of the Elevator Pitch (Nov. 18th, 6:30-7:30 pm. Location: Manhattan). Learn to articulate your value and values with ease, savvy, and style. Our attention spans are shorter. Our lives are busier. And our mental hard drives are at capacity. So when you only have 30 seconds to make an impact, you need to be sure of both what to say and how to say it. The “elevator pitch” can feel outdated, phony, and utterly cringe-inducing . . . but it doesn't have to be. A well crafted elevator pitch can bring out your inner rock star, give people a sense of what you're about (beyond what you "do" -and begin genuine connections. New York-based voice and speech coaches Casey Erin Clark and Julie Fogh of Vital Voice Training will give you the principles to construct and refine a compelling elevator pitch AND show you how to deliver it in a way that truly lands and connects with your audience. Workshop participants will be able to get on your feet, practice, and start to make some connections with other professionals. Post packet PDF included. Cost: $35
results.name: Vital Voice Jam Sessions:  The Art of the Elevator Pitch

I end up working out of my home, but also in cafes, bookstores or on campus to be more productive and figured I might as well try to start this up. results.description:
This group will focus on distilling the essential teachings of the major traditions, East and West, in an effective and interesting synthesis applicable to the postmodern world. If you despise the anything-goes approach of the New Age movement, the overly logical methods of philosophers, and the rather secular style of meditation, yet strongly desire to know what worlds beyond this one contain, this group may help you in your quest.

The topics we'll cover will be eclectic and assorted, and may include things like: the myth and symbolism of ancient Egypt, the Kaballah, shamanic journeying, awakening Kundalini, death and rebirth, modern occultism and the left-hand path, creating rituals, understanding one's true purpose, energy healing, invoking spirits and using mundras. 

Whenever possible, I'll focus on application and direct experience of what I discuss through the use of art, rituals and specific practices.

This group will most likely be best suited to those with several years of magical/spiritual study or those who've been initiated into at least one tradition, but anyone is welcome to come.

If you would like to co-teach any of these topics or would prefer one-on-one instruction/exploration, please message me.
results.name: Restoring Spiritual Tradition

results.description: IMPERFECT DOGS (and handlers) ARE WELCOME! If you are looking for a positive environment where you can work your dog around other people and dogs, you've found it. This group is all about building a positive relationship and bond with your dog through science based training and benevolent leadership with fun activities and events. We host monthly meetings so that you can work on your dog's loose leash walking, socialization, and/or reactivity challenges in a relaxed environment and with guidance from the organizer or other members of meetup group. We are here to have fun and make every experience with our dogs a mutually enjoyable one for both handler and dog. We are offering some basic obedience classes as well. The bulk of the classes are related to helping your dog attain the skills necessary to achieve Canine Good Citizen, an AKC-recognized title. The skills of CGC should be something every dog owner strives for. We offer all CGC classes as small classes so that you get personal attention and help during each class. We offer free training classes for foster dogs of rescue groups and shelters as we strive to be a community training resource for the homeless animals. We ask as a member that you promise to: 1. Be loyal to the absent and treat one another with kindness. We have no patience for drama or pettiness. 2. Breed discrimination is not tolerated. We love all dogs, big and small. 3. Class sizes are limited! If you RSVP, please honor it. 4. Always bring: Water, potty bags, high-value treats or toy items, and always bring a good attitude 5. Respect of other dog/handler teams is a must. Your dog should only meet other dogs when invited to do so by its handler. Please ask before you assume! 6. No retractable leashes. 7. One dog per handler for most events. If you would like special consideration, please email the organizer. 8. Please keep dogs that are in training in collars or harnesses they cannot escape from. The absolute worst thing would be to lose a dog at an event. Please be patient as this group develops and grows. If you have any questions, concerns, or suggestions, please let me know. This meet up is open for all dog lovers (you don't have to have a dog), owners, adopters, rescuers, volunteers, who are seeking the balanced relationship between dogs and human, raising the awareness of the importance of dog training and responsible dog ownership.  The meet up events include but not limited to: Dog Obedience Training; Dog Agility Training; Dog Rehabilitation; Off-leash adventures; Skijoring; BikeJoring; etc Locations of the meetups -Staten Island South Beach Area. When joining this Meetup group, please post a picture of your dog as your profile picture. Meet Up group are safe, therefore, everyone must keep their dogs up to date with all vaccinations and only join the pack if there is no history of uncontrollable aggressive behavior. By joining the group, you agree to release the groups organizer and members from any and all liability with regard to group activities. You are responsible for your dog at all events and agree to keep your Shepherd under control. ? dog under control. All members are asked to make a Monthly donation of $10.00 per household to keep the Meetup page up and running. This will cover the expense of the site and the time the organizer puts into setting up monthly Meetup. Membership Dues is $10.00 per visit.
results.name: Staten Island Active Dogs Meetup

results.description:
WHAT THE MEETUP IS ABOUT: Participants will learn and discuss the main scientific Big Bang theories, without the mathematics or physics background required to follow modern scientific theories of Big Bang Creation in detail. I started a few years ago a similar successful monthly discussion group in Ithaca (Cornell University) New York. I go back once a month to Ithaca to continue the discussion group.

IDEAL MEMBERS: People that are interested in the scientific explanations of how the Universe was created.

WHY MEMBERS SHOULD JOIN: To learn about Big Bang Theories and Problems of Big Bang Creation.

WHAT MEMBERS CAN EXPECT: At the meetings, I will distribute notes and explain Big Bang Creation theories and their problems. The group will then ask questions about what wasn't clear in the explanation. A general discussion will then follow about the importance of the theories.
results.name: New York Big Bang Discussion

results.description:
BewilderArts provides space for Teaching Artists, Educators, Arts Activists, Facilitators and Mentors to explore the communal and humanitarian potentials of art. Bewilder Arts advocates on behalf of participants and practitioners by working in solidarity, and valuing the workshop space as a place of constant discussion and learning.

The mission of BewilderArts is to foster a community of current and future Teaching Artists, Practitioners and Activists in New York City.

By working in solidarity, and valuing the workshop space as a place of constant discussion and learning, BewilderArts aims to explore the communal and humanitarian potentials of art. As the name implies, we work towards these goals with an approach that embraces new ideas, new concepts, and new possibilities. 

Workshop Days - BewilderArts Workshop Days are designed to highlight and demonstrate Arts Education / Arts Activist work currently happening in New York City. By bringing together professional organizations and facilitating artists, Workshop Days facilitate accessible, cross-discipline arts /activism skill-sharing. Applied arts disciplines include Community Outreach, Writing to Performance, Museum Education, Forum Theater, Sustainable Arts and Therapeutic Arts.Process Days - BewilderArts Process Days provide space for Teaching Artists to pitch and practice new workshops, as well as propose discussion topics relating to best practice, peer-to-peer support, and personal and professional goal charting. Teaching Artists are invited to propose Process Days through our Submit Proposal page.

Goals for BewilderArts:

Continue providing free, comprehensive, and quality Workshop and Process Days for artists, activists, educators, and Teaching Artists.Organize conferences, panels, and forums bringing together practitioners, participants and host communities (i.e. care homes, hospitals, prisons, schools and youth centers).Launch a Mentor / Training Program for young artists and activists interested in becoming professional Teaching Artists.Establish an e-library of relevant materials, including BewilderArts produced work.BewilderArts is open to current and future Teaching Artists engaged in: applied arts, narrative arts, healing arts, educational arts, participatory arts, therapeutic arts, artivism, process-based arts, differently-abled arts, integrated arts, community arts, and expanding arts access to underserved communities. Within these contexts, Teaching Artists may specialize in a variety of artistic disciplines: dance, theatre, performance art, spoken word, fiction, memoir, poetry, found arts, painting, drawing, collaging, photography, and sculpture. 

BewilderArts is primarily about visibility and validation for participants and practitioners alike. We hope you will join us, and we look forward to the adventures ahead.
results.name: BewilderArts: A Workshop Collective

results.description: The Body Image Workshop was founded by Lubna Khalid, CCEP My vision to bring consciousness to our own body images and the impact they have on our lives. By doing so, we may begin to unburden ourselves from these beliefs so that we may see, feel and experience our bodies and those of others in deeper, more truer ways. My workshops use Core Energetics concepts and techniques. Core Energetics is a body-oriented psychotherapy that views healing and growth as the integration of mind, body, emotions and spirit.
results.name: The Body Image Workshop

results.description:
Ready to fall in love? 

To have the crazy, sexy, passionate relationship you’ve always fantasized about? 

You’ve joined the right group.

Since you’re here, I can only figure that putting yourself out there isn’t the challenge.

Do you keep attracting the same relationship, only with a different person?

Or maybe you go on a lot of lackluster dates?

Or have trouble getting past date number one?

I get it. Trust me, I’ve been there. This group exists to shift that paradigm, and to have fun while doing it!

So what are we going to do together?

We’re going to connect.

We’re going to travel.

We’re going to grow.

We’re going to get uncomfortable.

We’re going to stretch ourselves and be comforted that everyone else is also out of their comfort zones.

Most importantly we’re going to have fun and meet interesting people, who’s intentions are a little deeper than finding their next date.

Thank you so much for being willing to allow me in on your journey, and I can’t wait to meet you!

~ Danita

results.description:
This NYC Peace with Cash Flows Meetup group is for anyone interested in having peace with their personal current cash flows and professional networking.  Also if you are having peace with your current personal cash flows and interested in helping others.  I started this group, because as I was growing in different areas of my life it took time for me to be at peace and to be on the same page with others that I loved. Once I found that peace and meaning in my life, I felt called to encourage others and to be around encouragers.  It is great to know where you want to go by having goals.  Saving and investing could be important but it is not everything.  Now let’s take it a step further and gain peace by getting totally clear about our current personal cash flows.  Let's do this without having destination disease.  Let's be present in the movement but totally clear with what is going on.  Let’s be proactive, be the catalyst to change and always be prepared to react to new events that affect our lives.  Let's build with like-minded people that are thinking clear and concise about their current cash flows.

At the meetup we will always make sure their is 15mins to 30mins for networking encouragement.  We will show a 15 min Prezi presentation that will show universal mandatory and non mandatory items for a typical family.  Then we will go through some examples of how we can loose your peace as it comes to our personal cash flows.  While we go through the prezi we will discuss hidden current costs that can effect your current cash flows.  Also we will share solutions to increase peace in ourselves by getting clear on our cash flows.  We suggest you share issues and solutions throughout the process. 

Bring business cards or a personal card.
results.name: NYC Peace with Cash flows Meetup

This meeting of Women of The Clothe will be based on our calling, our vocation and our love of the Trinity.
It will be Women who have been called to serve in the pulpit and the struggles, trials and triumphs that we have endured and overcame.
To be a Sisterhood that understands the tears, heartaches, loves and joys.
results.name: Bronx Women of the ClothSpiritual Growth Meetup

results.description:
Those who have had Near Death Experiences are encouraged to join along with those who are interested and/or research them. Those also seeking Spirituality not religion are also encouraged to come.
Materials, Information and Literature will be suggested and/or provided for personal and research purposes. We look foward to meeting you!
results.name: Anderson SC Near Death Experiences Meetup

results.description: This Organization's soul purpose is to help and inspire creatives PAVE THEIR OWN WAY. Each and every event and meetup will be one of value to help uplift independent creatives. There will be motivational speakers, thought leaders, trainings, networking events and many other helpful resources to come!
results.name: PaveYourOwnWay:Dedication to Helping & Motivating Creatives

results.description: We host both speed dating  and social events for single professionals in New York City. We are an active group with monthly FUN and EXCITING events where singles can meet.  We are open to requests.
results.name: New York Singles Speed Dating
